intro: Tephrosia pseudosphaerosperma, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with compound leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or white. Its seeds are enclosed in small, pod-like fruits, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils and woodland areas.
